reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth ever penny
reviews.reviewText: I'm in love with this bag! The strap is incredibly durable and can be very short or very long, all the zippers were in great condition, the whole bag is made out of really good quality fabric. It fits EVERYTHING!! My iPad, a couple diapers (I'm a mom) a change of clothes, pens, medication, my large wallet, phone, keys, small pack of wipes. I stuffed this thing full with even more just to see how much I could get into all the convenient pockets. If you're looking for a lightweight good quality bag this is the one

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, Cute, Love the Red - it's definitely on the pink, rosy scale
reviews.reviewText: Just got it. Love it.I measured it like a crazy person prior to buying and I'm very happy with it. The outside seems pretty sturdy. The inside liner is a bit flimsy, and one of the interior zippers was half broken, but I zipped it closed and open and it seems fine now.The shoulder strap is RIDICULOUSLY long and the same color as the bag. I love that. I have an executive size Rocketbook - can never remember if it's a core or the other one, but it fits in easily. My journal fits in a secret pocket under the front flap. The pockets are fantastic. Not super tight like some other bags. Easy to get into, which means I will actually use them. Lots of room for pens, which is good. The side pockets? Yeah. Kinda pointless. I might use the one with a flap for my earbuds. I'll need to be confident they won't fall out. I stuck a pen in the open pocket on the other side. That's fine.There are two main pockets, both plenty roomy. I plan to carry my lunch in one of them. I bought this because I started using my lunch bag as a purse, which was stupid. This seems like a better option :-) I like the leather pulls. It's pretty. Usually I get army green or khaki. This is definitely cuter. And at $20? A bargain.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have had a lot of purses. They always end up getting messy and I have to dump them out and reorganize every week or two. I bought maybe six purses advertising lots of storage options to compare them and eliminate the dreaded purse reorganizing. This bag won by a landslide and the others went back. Many other similar products have lots of storage but it’s not all useable space due to the size and depth of the pockets/zippered components. This bag has the best storage of any purse I’ve ever owned by far. It has enough pockets and zippered sections to keep me organized, but not so many it’s annoying or I can’t find what I need without looking in six places. I no longer have to reorganize my purse. Ever. I have had three and used them over a two year period heavily, the only wear any show is the rubber gripper on the handle of one bag split in the middl after heavy use. No fraying, no holes, no broken zippers, no seams coming undone. Lightweight but stores so much you won’t believe it. Intuitive design that just makes sense. Super reasonable price. And quality construction, you can tell it’s well made and will hold up. I will use this bag forever.Update: this is still the best bag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect, other than the long strap
reviews.reviewText: Being a man who crams a lot of crap into his pockets who got sick of bulging sides, I wondered one day why it must be that women are fortunate enough to be culturally accepted in carrying a bag around with their essentials while men are ridiculed for doing the same. I mean, who actually accepts men carrying purses around, right? Seinfeld had a whole episode about this, the "European Carry-All" episode which is sort of where I got the idea in the first place. I went looking and found that there are indeed a number of "men purse" products, which it does help to not actually CALL it a purse, but rather like this one, a "mini messenger bag" or any of the several other names I've seen. Whatever. It also helps to get one that looks more like a bag that men might carry.I personally have no concern for fashion, no sense of fashion or style, and wouldn't care at all what the hell the thing looks like for the most part, but I do still prefer to avoid the sneering and silly remarks that might happen if the bag I'm carrying is perceived as being too similar to typical women's purses. This bag looked just about perfect in that it could very well be something one would carry on a camping outing or might just be a big lunch box or perhaps something to put a tablet and one's pile of cords and chargers into. Nobody really knows what's in it.In my case, the several convenient pockets allow me to carry my small umbrella, my medication box, wallet, keys, pack of tissues, spare chargers, some small tools, a couple of pens and a notepad, etc. That is, all the stuff I might just happen to need. I no longer have to cram my pockets full and then still have to leave behind half of the stuff I wish I could have with me.The only real downside to this bag is that the long strap is completely built into the bag. It also has the really nice short carrying handle on top so that I can carry it that way when I prefer, and sometimes I do use the shoulder strap, but if I prefer to carry by the short handle, I'd rather detach the long strap and stick it in the bag rather than have that thing hanging down nearly to the ground. Some quick release hooks would have been preferable for me over sewing the strap to the bag permanently. I'm tempted to cut the strap off and make my own strap hooks. If they would design the bag this way, it would be a 5.
Love this purse it has so many pockets . Great material will hold up .dries very well when u get caught in the rain .lol

reviews.reviewerName: Yam pistano..very good quality..thank you..worth buying

reviews.reviewText: So after my last bag was a bit to small, and the zippers went on it after like 12 months, I decided to pay a little more and try out this bag. I'm pleased with the amount of room I now have, and the zippers seem to be much better quality too. I have read reviews that the strap was to long. Ummm, it's adjustable and I have no idea how anyone can this it's to long. I have adjusted mine to suit me perfectly.I think it could be a little cheaper that what I paid, but over all I'm happy with this bag.
Items I carry didn't fit where I need them to, but like the colour, material and the quailty seems way better than other products I have looked at. Sorry my items didn't fit.
